meta.content: Jeopardy Archive Gary Tse Julia Marsan Zach Atwell Final clue response question answer Daily Double

meta.name: description
meta.content: An archive of clues and players for Jeopardy! show #7470.

td.p: Gary Tse, a freshman at the United States Naval Academy from Ellicott City, Maryland
Julia Marsan, a senior at Georgetown University from Brookfield, Wisconsin
Zach Atwell, a senior from the University of Kentucky from Lexington, Kentucky

tr.td: SERIOUS HARDWARE
HEALTH & MEDICINE
MTV MOVIE AWARD FOR BEST VILLAIN
GOVERNMENT AGENCIES
GEOGRAPHER'S DICTIONARY
COLLEGE MAJORS IN OTHER WORDS

div.h3: Scores at the end of the Double Jeopardy! Round:

tr.td: Zach
Julia
Gary

div.onmouseover:
toggle('clue_FJ', 'clue_FJ_stuck', '(Alex Trebek: [To Zach] For the International Exposition in Paris, yes.)
...
(Alex Trebek: So, Julia Marsan, congratulations, young lady! Come on over here. You are going to be a semifinalist, and now here are the other winners of the quarterfinal games this week...)
(Lilly: Lilly Chin, MIT.)
(Viraj: Viraj Mehta, Stanford.)
(Alex Bourzutschky: Alex Bourzutschky, Caltech.)
(Mohan: Mohan Malhotra, NYU.)
(Alex Trebek: And the other four positions will go to the high scorers among non-winners. Here they are...)
(Netanel: Netanel Paley, Yeshiva University.)
(Mari: Mari Hanley, Stetson University.)
(Clarissa: Clarissa Santori, Northeastern University.)
(Alex Trebek: Wait a minute, that\'s only three. We need four. That must be Gary Tse over here! Come on over, Gary. The semifinals begin on Monday, ladies and gentlemen. Be sure to join us for that. It\'s going to be an exciting week. Take care. So long.)
ZachWhat is the Eiffel Tower?
$6,400
JuliaWhat is the Eiffel Tower?
$9,000
GaryWhat is the Eiffel Tower?
$0
the Eiffel Tower')

tr.td: WORLD LANDMARKS
Completed in 1884, the Washington Monument became the tallest manmade structure but 4 years later was surpassed by this
Zach
Julia
Gary
3rd place: $5,000 if eliminated
Automatic semifinalist
2nd place: $5,000 if eliminated
Zach
Julia
Gary

21 R
(including 1 DD),
5 W

(including 2 DDs),
